intro: Acrostichum heudelotti, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shady environments such as swamps and marshes. Its flowers are usually pink or red and bloom during the wet season. Acrostichum heudelotti is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking foliage and floral display.
